interestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world, standing at 8,848 meters.
The Pyramids of Giza are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris was once the tallest man-made structure in the world.
Russia is the largest country in the world by area, covering more than 17 million square kilometers.
The Great Wall of China is visible from space on rare occasions.
The United States is the third largest country in the world by both area and population.
India is the world's largest democracy and has a rich cultural heritage.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world.
Japan is an archipelago consisting of over 6,800 islands.
Germany is known for its rich history, including being the birthplace of famous composers like Beethoven and Bach.
South Africa is known for its diverse cultures and languages, with 11 official languages.
Mexico is home to the ancient Mayan and Aztec civilizations, known for their impressive pyramids.
Italy is famous for its art, architecture, and cuisine, including pizza and pasta.
Spain is known for its rich history, including the influence of the Moors in architecture and culture.
The United Kingdom is made up of four countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland.
Argentina is known for its tango music and dance, as well as its beef production.
Turkey is a transcontinental country, straddling both Europe and Asia.
South Korea is known for its advanced technology and pop culture, including K-pop music.
Indonesia is the world's largest archipelago, consisting of over 17,000 islands.
Saudi Arabia is known for its vast deserts and as the birthplace of Islam.
Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa and has a rich cultural diversity.
Pakistan is home to the Indus Valley Civilization, one of the world's oldest urban cultures.
Bangladesh is known for its rich textile industry and vibrant culture.
The Philippines is an archipelago consisting of over 7,000 islands.
Vietnam is known for its rich history, including the ancient city of Hoi An and the Cu Chi Tunnels.
Thailand is known for its beautiful beaches, rich culture, and delicious cuisine.
Colombia is famous for its coffee, emeralds, and vibrant music scene.
Poland is known for its medieval architecture and rich history, including the historic city of Kraków.
Sweden is known for its high quality of life, innovation, and beautiful natural landscapes.
The Netherlands is famous for its windmills, tulips, and extensive canal systems.
Belgium is known for its chocolate, waffles, and being the headquarters of the European Union.
Greece is known for its ancient history, including the birthplace of democracy and the Olympic Games.
Portugal is famous for its maritime history and the Age of Discoveries.
The Czech Republic is known for its historic castles and beautiful architecture, especially in Prague.
Hungary is famous for its thermal baths and the Danube River running through its capital, Budapest.
Finland is known for its high standard of living and beautiful natural landscapes, including thousands of lakes.
Norway is famous for its stunning fjords and the Northern Lights.
